issues.title: Blind BBS API Review and Suggestions
issues.author: Wind4Greg
issues.body:
Here is a quick review/summary of the current Blind BBS API with a few small suggestions. This draft follows the the BBS Signature Scheme naming conventions that use camel case for external API and core function names and snake case for helper and utility functions. Also the consistent use of the *BBS.get_random_scalars()* function call where random values are needed allows for insertion of mocked random scalars for test vector generation.

## Commitment Computation

(commitment_with_proof, secret_prover_blind) = **commit**(committed_messages, api_id)

Uses *BBS.messages_to_scalars(...)*, *BBS.create_generators(...)*, and *CoreCommit(...)*.

Better names? **Commit**. Why is this lower case when all other start with upper case.

## Core Commitment Computation

(commit_with_proof, secret_prover_blind) = **CoreCommit**(blind_generators, committed_messages, api_id)

Uses *BBS.get_random_scalars()*, *calculate_blind_challenge(...)*, and *commitment_with_proof_to_octets(...)*

## Commitment Validation and Deserialization

commit = **deserialize_and_validate_commit**(commitment_with_proof, blind_generators, api_id)

Uses *octets_to_commitment_with_proof(...)* and *CoreCommitVerify(...)*

## Core Commitment Verification

result = **CoreCommitVerify**(commitment, commitment_proof, blind_generators, api_id)

Uses *calculate_blind_challenge(...)*.

## Blind Signature Generation

blind_signature = **BlindSign**(SK, PK, commitment_with_proof, header, messages)

Uses *BBS.create_generators(...)*, *BBS.messages_to_scalars(...)*, *deserialize_and_validate_commit(...)*, and *FinalizeBlindSign(...)*.

## Blind Signature Verification

result = **Verify**(PK, signature, header, messages, committed_messages, secret_prover_blind)

Uses *prepare_parameters(...)* and *BBS.CoreVerify(...)*.

Better names? **BlindVerify**, **VerifyBlind**, i.e. mimic *BlindSign*.

## Proof Generation

proof = **BlindProofGen**(PK, signature, header, ph, messages, committed_messages, disclosed_indexes, disclosed_commitment_indexes, secret_prover_blind)

Uses *prepare_parameters(...)*, and *BBS.CoreProofGen(...)*.

## Proof Verification

result = **BlindProofVerify**(PK, proof, header, ph, L, disclosed_messages, disclosed_committed_messages,disclosed_indexes, disclosed_committed_indexes)

Uses *prepare_parameters(...)* and *BBS.CoreProofVerify(...)*.

## Finalize Blind Sign

blind_signature = **FinalizeBlindSign**(SK, PK, B, generators, blind_generators, header, api_id)

Uses: *BBS.calculate_domain(...)*, *serialize(...)*, *BBS.hash_to_scalar(...)*, and *signature_to_octets*

issues.title: Current Blind BBS Test Cases/Vectors and Needed Updates
issues.author: Wind4Greg
issues.body:
These are in the repo but not in the draft. Also need to be verified. There is a similar set for SHAKE-256. Due to signature API change all signature and proof computations need to be recomputed and the files edited appropriately.

### Commitments

Performed by _prover_ prior to blind signing.

- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/commit/commit001.json
-     case: valid no committed messages commitment with proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/commit/commit002.json
-     case: valid multiple committed messages commitment with proof

### Signatures

Blind and unblind signing from the issuer.  **Issue**: the API has been modified and there is no longer a `signerBlind` parameter. All signatures need to be recalculated and the case of "no signer blind" (signature005.json) no longer makes sense. **Note** there is a difference between "no commitment" and a "commitment on no messages". These are different edge cases and are included below.

- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/signature/signature001.json
-     case: valid no prover committed messages, no signer messages signature
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/signature/signature002.json
-     case: valid multi prover committed messages, no signer messages signature
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/signature/signature003.json
-     case: valid no prover committed messages, multiple signer messages signature
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/signature/signature004.json
-     case: valid multiple signer and prover committed messages signature
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/signature/signature005.json
-     case: valid multiple signer and prover committed messages, no signer blind signature
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/signature/signature006.json
-     case: valid no commitment signature

### Proofs

Proofs generated by the holder. Need to be updated with recomputed signatures.

- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof001.json
-     case: valid all prover committed messages and signer messages revealed proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof002.json
-     case: valid half prover committed messages and all signer messages revealed proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof003.json
-     case: valid all prover committed messages and half signer messages revealed proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof004.json
-     case: valid half prover committed messages and half signer messages revealed proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof005.json
-     case: valid no prover committed messages and half signer messages revealed proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof006.json
-     case: valid half prover committed messages and no signer messages revealed proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof007.json
-     case: valid no prover committed messages and no signer messages revealed proof
- filename: bls12-381-sha-256/proof/proof008.json
-     case: valid no commitment, half signer messages revealed proof

pulls.author: Wind4Greg
pulls.body:
This PR addresses issue https://github.com/cfrg/draft-irtf-cfrg-bbs-blind-signatures/issues/3 by

1. Recomputing all test vectors based on the removal of the *signer blind* parameter from the API.
2. Removes signature test case specific to "no signer blind" (since it is not needed) and renumbers the signature test case files.
